unwrap3D.Features package

Submodules

unwrap3D.Features.features module

class unwrap3D.Features.features.DsiftExtractor(gridSpacing, patchSize, nrml_thres=1.0, sigma_edge=0.8, sift_thres=0.2, Nangles=8, Nbins=4, alpha=9.0)[source]

Bases: object

The class that does dense sift feature extractor. See https://github.com/Yangqing/dsift-python Sample Usage:

extractor = DsiftExtractor(gridSpacing,patchSize,[optional params]) feaArr,positions = extractor.process_image(Image)

Reference

  1. Jia and T. Darrell. “Heavy-tailed Distances for Gradient Based Image Descriptors”. NIPS 2011.

Lowe, David G. “Object recognition from local scale-invariant features.” Proceedings of the seventh IEEE international conference on computer vision. Vol. 2. Ieee, 1999.

Methods

calculate_sift_grid(image, gridH, gridW)

This function calculates the unnormalized sift features at equidistantly spaced control points in the image as specified by the number in height (gridH) and in width (gridW) It is called by process_image().

gen_dgauss(sigma)

generates a derivative of Gaussian filter with the same specified \(\sigma\) in both the X and Y directions.

normalize_sift(feaArr)

This function does sift feature normalization following David Lowe’s definition (normalize length -> thresholding at 0.2 -> renormalize length)

process_image(image[, positionNormalize, …])

processes a single image, return the locations and the values of detected SIFT features.
calculate_sift_grid(image, gridH, gridW)[source]

This function calculates the unnormalized sift features at equidistantly spaced control points in the image as specified by the number in height (gridH) and in width (gridW) It is called by process_image().

gen_dgauss(sigma)[source]

generates a derivative of Gaussian filter with the same specified \(\sigma\) in both the X and Y directions.

normalize_sift(feaArr)[source]

This function does sift feature normalization following David Lowe’s definition (normalize length -> thresholding at 0.2 -> renormalize length)

process_image(image, positionNormalize=True, verbose=True)[source]

processes a single image, return the locations and the values of detected SIFT features. image: a M*N image which is a numpy 2D array. If you pass a color image, it will automatically be convertedto a grayscale image. positionNormalize: whether to normalize the positions to [0,1]. If False, the pixel-based positions of the top-right position of the patches is returned.

Return values: feaArr: the feature array, each row is a feature positions: the positions of the features

class unwrap3D.Features.features.SingleSiftExtractor(patchSize, nrml_thres=1.0, sigma_edge=0.8, sift_thres=0.2, Nangles=8, Nbins=4, alpha=9.0)[source]

Bases: unwrap3D.Features.features.DsiftExtractor

The simple wrapper class that does feature extraction, treating the whole image as a local image patch.

Methods

calculate_sift_grid(image, gridH, gridW)

This function calculates the unnormalized sift features at equidistantly spaced control points in the image as specified by the number in height (gridH) and in width (gridW) It is called by process_image().

gen_dgauss(sigma)

generates a derivative of Gaussian filter with the same specified \(\sigma\) in both the X and Y directions.

normalize_sift(feaArr)

This function does sift feature normalization following David Lowe’s definition (normalize length -> thresholding at 0.2 -> renormalize length)

process_image(image)

processes a single image, return the locations and the values of detected SIFT features.
process_image(image)[source]

processes a single image, return the locations and the values of detected SIFT features. image: a M*N image which is a numpy 2D array. If you pass a color image, it will automatically be convertedto a grayscale image. positionNormalize: whether to normalize the positions to [0,1]. If False, the pixel-based positions of the top-right position of the patches is returned.

Return values: feaArr: the feature array, each row is a feature positions: the positions of the features
